bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Jefferson Randolph Kean, November 5, 1901

div1.p: Reed relays news of additional candidates for Surgeon General. He believes Kean should be Surgeon General instead of himself because he is concerned about his age.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Jefferson Randolph Kean, November 5, 1901
div1.opener:
Confidential.
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
WASHINGTON.
Nov. 5, 1901.
My dear Mr “General Manager”;
div1.p:
Here
I am staying in my office
until long after office
hours, solely for the pur-
pose of conferring with
your Highness concerning
matters of state- The plot,
as it were, thickens- Seve-
ral new candidates for
ye uncle George Miller's
boots have appeared on
the horizon. Your prede-
cessor in the 7th Corps,
I am so told, is making
strennuous efforts for the
place- This I have on the
best authority- Still another
candidate has appeared in
the person of our good
friend & efficient medical
officer, La Garde. He told
me this a little while ago,
and hopes to obtain General
Wood's influence- Said that
he had written to him for
his assistance- He was
frank enough to say that
he believed that the Pres-
ident would appoint
some man younger than
the Colonels & Lt. Colonels
and that the fight would
be open to all comers-
He added that he had told
me this, because he believed
that I should, also, become
a candidate, and should know
that my juniors were trying
to obtain promotion over
me- Said that he had been
advised by a general officer
on duty in this city to put
himself in the race, and
that he had determined
to do so. E. C. Carter is,
also, “willing”, and I am told
that Munson has a
sheet to windward! What's
the matter with my El mio
amigo Carrissimo, Jefferson
R. Kean, late chief Surgeon,
7th Army Corps? Don't let
me stand in your way- I
already feel that I am en-
tirely too old for the place,
when La Garde & Munson have
entered- When does the Gen-
eral start North? I think
that he would do well to
also speak to the Secretary, as
well as to the President-
I think that since the Edito-
rial of Novr 2nd in the A & N.
Journal (was it inspired?)
has appeared, that your proposed
“notice” in that Journal would
not be inappropriate- Good
luck to you and my best love-
